personId.description: ID of the insured Person. IDs are generated by the broker in the offer request and must be reported back by the insurer in the offer. The insurer may add new insured persons, in which case a new ID must be generated and reported back to the broker.

payroll.description: Fixed payroll DSB amount in CHF

benefitCoverage.description: Must be provided if the role of the insured person is either 'Self-employed person' or 'contributing family member'

premiumPersonMentionedByName.description: Premium of the person mentioned by name total. Must be set for offer and omitted during request.

netPremiumDSBPercentage.description: Net premium rate for daily sickness benefits. The net premium rate corresponds to the percentage of the net premium offered after deducting any discounts (combination discounts, payroll discounts, etc.), but without surcharges for fixed premium components. The net premium includes any final fee, brokerage fee, taxes and duties. Corresponds to the premium charged to the customer.

netPremiumDSBMPercentage.description: Net premium rate for maternity benefits. The net premium rate corresponds to the percentage of the net premium offered after deducting any discounts (combination discounts, payroll discounts, etc.), but without surcharges for fixed premium components. premiumMinimumAmount.description: Minimum premium for DSB fixed payroll in CHF
